numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a general pattern.
2. Many young people are 15 years old or older and 24 years old or younger.
3. Many older people are older than 40 years.
4. Young people are more optimistic about the future than older people.
5. Some countries are developed countries.
6. Some developed countries have greater wealth.
7. In developed countries with greater wealth, the optimism-divide between young people and older people is more significant than in less wealthy countries.
8. The quality of life in a country does not seem to have a clear relationship with the optimism of the people of the country.
9. Several countries have a large percentage of people in poverty or in conflict.
10. Several of these countries rank higher in optimism than the USA.
11. Several of these countries rank higher in optimism than Germany.
12. Several of these countries rank higher in optimism than Japan.
13. Several of these countries rank higher in optimism than France.
14. I wonder why Indonesian young adults are so positive about the future compared to young adults in other countries.
15. I wonder whether this positivity relates to the quality of life in Indonesia.
16. I wonder whether this positivity relates to the culture in Indonesia.
17. I wonder whether this positivity relates to the government system in Indonesia.
18. I wonder what causes people to become less hopeful about the future when they are older.
19. I wonder whether the hopes of young people are misplaced.
20. I wonder whether naive idealism causes the hopes of young people.
21. I wonder whether the belief that young people can change the future for the better causes the hopes of young people.
22. I wonder whether older people have less faith in younger generations.
23. I wonder whether this lack of faith causes older people to believe that things will get worse.
